page.title: 16Carlton Towers (continued)
page.content: The dining room shows good Chippendale furniture. The chimney piece is decorated with portraits of ancestors. The chapel is still usable and has Flemish carved wood panels showing the beheading of John the Baptist. The gold faced clock is wound up each week by hand.The servants' quarters show how well they used to be looked after. The family still visit the Towers, often bringing friends to stay. Still with its periodic furniture, Carlton Towers is a good example of a Victorian stately home.It is open to the public on bank holidays and at weekands.
